name: Split Squats Right
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart, take a large step to the right with your right foot and place your left foot behind you for support.
 
2. Lower your body down into a lunge, keeping your back straight and your front knee at a 90-degree angle or slightly below.

3. Keep your core engaged and your body in alignment as you lower yourself down.

4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement in this position.

5. Push through the ground with your right foot to lift your left foot back up into standing, keeping both legs straight.

6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions on the same leg, before switching to the other side.
short_summary: Split squats are a functional lower body exercise that strengthens quadriceps, hamstrings, glutes and core muscles.
